metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3344 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the KVM's AMD nested virtualization (SVM). A malicious L1 guest could purposely fail to intercept the shutdown of a cooperative nested guest (L2), possibly leading to a page fault and kernel panic in the host (L0). Maxim Levitsky discovered that the KVM nested virtualization (SVM) implementation for AMD processors in the Linux kernel did not properly handle nested shutdown execution. An attacker in a guest vm could use this to cause a denial of service (host kernel crash)

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3344` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3

No subscription required

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16

No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> it's possible only the first two commits are necessary

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-16.16').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1004.4').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was pending').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
